How to Install psl-make-dafsa on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • psl-make-dafsa

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install psl-make-dafsa on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing psl-make-dafsa on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall psl-make-dafsa in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install psl-make-dafsa, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install psl-make-dafsa Using apt

To install psl-make-dafsa in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install psl-make-dafsa using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install psl-make-dafsa

The installation of psl-make-dafsa might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install psl-make-dafsa Using apt-get

To install psl-make-dafsa using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install psl-make-dafsa.

sudo apt-get -y install psl-make-dafsa

Install psl-make-dafsa Using Synaptic

To install psl-make-dafsa using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install psl-make-dafsa on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for psl-make-dafsa. This will display the psl-make-dafsa package in the package window, now to install psl-make-dafsa, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the psl-make-dafsa package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of psl-make-dafsa.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install psl-make-dafsa Using aptitude

To install psl-make-dafsa on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of psl-make-dafsa.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install psl-make-dafsa using the command aptitude install psl-make-dafsa.

sudo aptitude -y install psl-make-dafsa

How to Upgrade psl-make-dafsa on debian

If you want to upgrade the psl-make-dafsa package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade psl-make-dafsa using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade psl-make-dafsa to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade psl-make-dafsa.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade psl-make-dafsa sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade psl-make-dafsa

Upgrade psl-make-dafsa using Aptitude

To upgrade psl-make-dafsa using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade psl-make-dafsa.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade psl-make-dafsa

Upgrade psl-make-dafsa using Synaptic

To upgrade psl-make-dafsa using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for psl-make-dafsa, now right-click psl-make-dafsa, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade psl-make-dafsa just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall psl-make-dafsa on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall psl-make-dafsa from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just psl-make-dafsa, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove psl-make-dafsa

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of psl-make-dafsa

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of psl-make-dafsa you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge psl-make-dafsa

Remove psl-make-dafsa using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall psl-make-dafsa using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for psl-make-dafsa, right-click the psl-make-dafsa package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall psl-make-dafsa click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install psl-make-dafsa on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade psl-make-dafsa using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of psl-make-dafsa then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
